trans-unit.source: Provides a control for viewing flow content in a continuous scrolling mode.
FlowDocumentScrollViewer shows content in continuous scrolling mode.
A similar control, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer>, shows content in page-at-a-time viewing mode.
Both <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> and FlowDocumentScrollViewer are fixed to a particular viewing mode.

On the other hand, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> includes features that enable the user to dynamically choose between various viewing modes (as provided by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReaderViewingMode> enumeration), at the cost of being heavier weight than <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentPageViewer> or FlowDocumentScrollViewer.
The following figure shows a FlowDocumentScrollViewer control with its default [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].

![Screenshot: Basic FlowDocumentScrollViewer](~/add/media/flowdocscrollviewer-main.png "Screenshot: Basic FlowDocumentScrollViewer") By default, a vertical scrollbar is always shown, and a horizontal scrollbar becomes visible if needed.

The default [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] for FlowDocumentScrollViewer does not include a toolbar; however, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsToolBarVisible%2A> property can be used to enable a built-in toolbar.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument> is the only allowable child element for a FlowDocumentScrollViewer.
A FlowDocumentScrollViewer element may host no more than one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> class.
Cancels any current printing job.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom*> level can be decreased.

Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.DecreaseZoom%2A> method decreases the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the amount specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
The value of this property is subject to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MinZoom%2A> property.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom*> level can be decreased; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.CanDecreaseZoom*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom*> level can be increased.

Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IncreaseZoom%2A> method increases the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the amount specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
The value of this property is subject to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MaxZoom%2A> property.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom*> level can be increased; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.CanDecreaseZoomProperty"></xref> dependency property.
To be added.
Executes the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom*> routed command.

The DecreaseZoom method decreases the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
Calling this method has no effect if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.CanDecreaseZoom%2A> property returns `false`.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument"></xref> that hosts the content to be displayed by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument"></xref> that hosts the content to be displayed by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Document*> dependency property.
To be added.
Toggles the **Find** dialog.
By default, Ctrl+F provides a keyboard shortcut for toggling the **Find** dialog.
The following figure shows the **Find** dialog on a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> with default UI.

![Screenshot: FlowDocumentScrollViewer find dialog](~/add/media/flowdocscrollviewer-find.png "Screenshot: FlowDocumentScrollViewer find dialog") The default **Find** dialog includes a field for entering search text, as well as buttons for **Find Next**, **Find Previous**, and **Options**.
The following **Find** options are provided by default: - Match whole word only - Match case - Match diacritic - Match kashida - Match alef hamza
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a horizontal scroll bar is shown.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility"></xref> .
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.HorizontalScrollBarVisibility*> dependency property.
To be added.
Executes the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom*> routed command.

The IncreaseZoom method increases the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level by the value specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement%2A> property.
Calling this method has no effect if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.CanIncreaseZoom%2A> property
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> displays selected text when the control does not have focus.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> displays selected text when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> does not have focus; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The registered default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsInactiveSelectionHighlightEnabled*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> has focus and selected text.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> displays selected text when the text box does not have focus; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The registered default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsSelectionActive*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether selection of content within the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> is enabled.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that selection is enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsSelectionEnabled*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> toolbar is visible.
The following figure shows the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> toolbar.
![Screenshot: FlowDocumentScrollViewer Toolbar](~/add/media/flowdocscrollviewer-toolbar.png "Screenshot: FlowDocumentScrollViewer Toolbar") By default, this toolbar is not shown.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the toolbar is visible; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.IsToolBarVisible*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets an enumerator that can iterate the logical children of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
An enumerator for the logical children.
Gets or sets the maximum allowable <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom*> level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The maximum allowable <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom*> level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 200.0 (a maximum zoom of 200%).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MaxZoom*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the minimum allowable <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom*> level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The minimum allowable <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom*> level for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 80.0 (a minimum zoom of 80%).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MinZoom*> dependency property.
To be added.
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
This method is invoked whenever <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> is called.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.OnApplyTemplate%2A>.
Handles the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.CancelPrint*> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.CancelPrint%2A> command is invoked.
Invoked whenever an unhandled <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ContextMenuOpening"></xref> routed event reaches this class in its route.
Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
Arguments of the event.
Creates and returns an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
Handles the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom*> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom%2A> command is invoked.
Handles the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Find*> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Find%2A> command is invoked.
Handles the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom*> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom%2A> command is invoked.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> routed event.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnKeyDown%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs"></xref> object containing the arguments associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> routed event.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel"></xref> routed event.
This method is called whenever the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel> routed event fires.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnMouseWheel%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseWheelEventArgs"></xref> object containing arguments associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseWheel"></xref> routed event.
Handles the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Print*> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Print%2A> command is invoked.
Called when a printing job has completed.
Invokes a standard **Print** dialog which can be used to print the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref> and configure printing preferences.
The default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] does not provide a **Print** button.
The following figure shows an example of a standard **Print** dialog.
Note that the specific appearance of the **Print** dialog may vary depending on the hosting computer's configuration.
![Screenshot: Print dialog box](~/add/media/flowdocrdr-print.png "Screenshot: Print dialog box")
Gets the selected content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
Selection is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The selected content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
Gets or sets the brush that highlights the selected text.

You can specify the brush that highlights selected text in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer> by setting the SelectionBrush and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionOpacity%2A> properties.
A brush that highlights the selected text.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the opacity of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush*>.
If you set the SelectionOpacity to 0, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> is transparent and is not visible.
If you set the SelectionOpacity to 1.0, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush%2A> is opaque and the selected text is not visible.
The opacity of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionBrush*>.
The default is 0.4.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.SelectionOpacity*> dependency property.
To be added.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object that specifies the type of service object to get.
A service object of type serviceType, or if there is no service object of type serviceType.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Document*> property to add a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument"></xref> as the content child for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer"></xref>.
An object to add as a child.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
A string to add to the object.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a vertical scroll bar is shown.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`||
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.VerticalScrollBarVisibility*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the current zoom level.

The zoom level is constrained by the values of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MinZoom%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.MaxZoom%2A> properties.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The current zoom level, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 100.0 (a zoom level of 100%).
Gets or sets the zoom increment.

The zoom increment is the percentage by which the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom%2A> level is increased or decreased when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.IncreaseZoom%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.DecreaseZoom%2A> commands are executed, respectively.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The current zoom increment, interpreted as a percentage.
The default is 10.0 (zoom increments by 10%).
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.ZoomIncrement*> dependency property.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentScrollViewer.Zoom*> dependency property.
To be added.
